conclusion: To solve for the magnitude of the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires in the given scenario.
The figure shows an equilateral triangular conductor frame with points A, B, and C, placed in a uniform magnetic field.
The given information states that there is an Ampere force F acting on segment AB.
Forces on AC and BC segments will be equal in magnitude but opposite in direction due to symmetry.
The triangle is equilateral, so the length of each side is the same.
Since the currents in the segments are equal, the forces on AC and BC will also be equal in magnitude to F but in opposite directions.
The net force on AC and BC segments combined will cancel out because they are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction.
The resultant force on the three segments of the equilateral triangular conductor frame will be the same as the force on the AB segment.
